text: Paul an Apostle of Jesus Christ, by the commandment of God our Savior, and of our Lord Jesus Christ our hope,
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto Timothy my natural son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God our Father, and from Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I besought thee to abide still in Ephesus, when I departed into Macedonia, so do, that thou mayest warn some, that they teach none other doctrine,
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither that they give heed to fables and genealogies which are endless, which breed questions rather than godly edifying which is by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the end of the commandment is love out of a pure heart, and of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the which things some have erred, and have turned unto vain jangling.
speaker: Narrator

text: They would be doctors of the Law, and yet understand not what they speak, neither whereof they affirm.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we know, that the Law is good, if a man use it lawfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: Knowing this, that the Law is not given unto a righteous man, but unto the lawless and disobedient, to the ungodly, and to sinners, to the unholy, and to the profane, to murderers of fathers and mothers, to manslayers,
speaker: Narrator

text: To whoremongers, to buggerers, to menstealers, to liars, to the perjured, and if there be any other thing that is contrary to wholesome doctrine,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which is according to the glorious Gospel of the blessed God, which is committed unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I thank him which hath made me strong, that is, Christ Jesus our Lord: for he counted me faithful, and put me in his service:
speaker: Narrator

text: When before I was a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and an oppressor: but I was received to mercy: for I did it ignorantly through unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love, which is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a true saying, and by all means worthy to be received, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding for this cause was I received to mercy, that Jesus Christ should first show on me all long suffering unto the ensample of them, which shall in time to come believe in him unto eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now unto the king everlasting, immortal, invisible, unto God only wise, be honor, and glory, for ever, and ever, Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This commandment commit I unto thee, son Timothy, according to the prophecies, which went before upon thee, that thou by them shouldest fight a good fight,
speaker: Narrator

text: Having faith and a good conscience, which some have put away, and as concerning faith, have made shipwreck.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of whom is Hymenaeus, and Alexander, whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they might learn not to blaspheme.
speaker: Narrator

text: I Exhort therefore, that first of all supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks be made for all men,
speaker: Narrator

text: For Kings, and for all that are in authority, that we may lead a quiet and a peaceable life, in all godliness, and honesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who will that all men shall be saved, and come unto the acknowledging of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is one God, and one Mediator between God and man, which is the man Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who gave himself a ransom for all men, to be that testimony in due time,
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereunto I am ordained a preacher and an Apostle (I speak the truth in Christ, and lie not) even a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will therefore that the men pray, everywhere lifting up pure hands without wrath, or doubting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also the women, that they array themselves in comely apparel, with shamefastness and modesty, not with braided hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly apparel,
speaker: Narrator

text: But (as becometh women that profess the fear of God) with good works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.
speaker: Narrator

text: I permit not a woman to teach, neither to usurp authority over the man, but to be in silence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman was deceived, and was in the transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, through bearing of children she shall be saved, if they continue in faith, and love, and holiness with modesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a true saying, If any man desire the office of a Bishop, he desireth a worthy work.
speaker: Narrator

text: A Bishop therefore must be unreproveable, the husband of one wife, watching, temperate, modest, harborous, apt to teach,
speaker: Narrator

text: Not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre, but gentle, no fighter, not covetous.
speaker: Narrator

text: One that can rule his own house honestly, having children under obedience with all honesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if any cannot rule his own house, how shall he care for the Church of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: He may not be a young scholar, lest he being puffed up fall into the condemnation of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must also be well reported of, even of them which are without, lest he fall into rebuke, and the snare of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise must Deacons be grave, not double tongued, not given unto much wine, neither to filthy lucre,
speaker: Narrator

text: Having the mystery of the faith in pure conscience.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them first be proved, then let them minister, if they be found blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise their wives must be honest, not evil speakers, but sober, and faithful in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the Deacons be the husbands of one wife, and such as can rule their children well, and their own households.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they that have ministered well, get themselves a good decree, and great liberty in the faith, which is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things write I unto thee, trusting to come very shortly unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest yet know, how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the Church of the living God, the pillar and ground of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And without controversy, great is the mystery of godliness, which is, God is manifested in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of Angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, and received up in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Spirit speaketh evidently, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, and shall give heed unto spirits of error, and doctrines of devils,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which speak lies through hypocrisy, and have their consciences burned with an hot iron,
speaker: Narrator

text: Forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats which God hath created to be received with giving thanks of them which believe and know the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For every creature of God is good, and nothing ought to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is sanctified by the word of God, and prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, which hast been nourished up in the words of faith, and of good doctrine which thou hast continually followed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But cast away profane, and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself unto godliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, which hath the promise of the life present, and of that that is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a true saying, and by all means worthy to be received.
speaker: Narrator

text: For therefore we labor and are rebuked, because we trust in the living God, which is the Savior of all men, specially of those that believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things warn and teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no man despise thy youth, but be unto them that believe, an ensample, in word, in conversation, in love, in spirit, in faith and in pureness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, and to doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Despise not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the company of the Eldership.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things exercise, and give thyself unto them, that it may be seen how thou profitest among all men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed unto thyself, and unto learning: continue therein: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rebuke not an elder, but exhort him as a father, and the younger men as brethren,
speaker: Narrator

text: The elder women as mothers, the younger as sisters, with all pureness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor widows, which are widows indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any widow have children or nephews let them learn first to show godliness toward their own house, and to recompense their kindred: for that is an honest thing, and acceptable before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she that is a widow indeed and left alone, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But she that liveth in pleasure, is dead, while she liveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things therefore warn them of, that they may be blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there be any that provideth not for his own, and namely for them of his household, he denieth the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, that hath been the wife of one husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: And well reported of for good works: if she have nourished her children, if she have lodged the strangers, if she have washed the Saints’ feet, if she have ministered unto them which were in adversity, if she were continually given unto every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But refuse the younger widows: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having damnation, because they have broken the first faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise also being idle they learn to go about from house to house: yea they are not only idle, but also prattlers and busybodies, speaking things which are not comely.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will therefore that the younger women marry, and bear children, and govern the house, and give none occasion to the adversary to speak evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For certain are already turned back after Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any faithful man or faithful woman have widows, let them minister unto them, and let not the Church be charged, that there may be sufficient for them that are widows indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Elders that rule well, let them be had in double honor, specially they which labor in the word and doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn: and, The laborer is worthy of his wages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against an Elder receive none accusation, but under two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Them that sin, rebuke openly, that the rest also may fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: I charge thee before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect Angels, that thou observe these things, without preferring one to another, and do nothing partially.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men’s sins; keep thyself pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach’s sake, and thine often infirmities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some men’s sins are open before hand, and go before unto judgment: but some men’s follow after.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also the good works are manifest before hand, and they that are otherwise, cannot be hid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let as many servants as are under the yoke, count their masters worthy of all honor, that the Name of God, and his doctrine be not evil spoken of.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they which have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren, but rather do service, because they are faithful, and beloved, and partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man teach otherwise, and consenteth not to the wholesome words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness,
speaker: Narrator

text: He is puffed up and knoweth nothing, but doteth about questions and strive of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,
speaker: Narrator

text: Froward disputations of men of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth, which think that gain is godliness: from such separate thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But godliness is great gain, if a man be content with that he hath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we brought nothing into the world, and it is certain, that we can carry nothing out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore when we have food and raiment, let us therewith be content.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they that will be rich, fall into tentation and snares, and into many foolish and noisome lusts, which drown men in perdition and destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the desire of money is the root of all evil, which while some lusted after they erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O man of God, flee these things, and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, and meekness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fight the good fight of faith: lay hold of eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: I charge thee in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and before Jesus Christ, which under Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou keep this commandment without spot, and unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which in due time he shall show, that is blessed and Prince only, the King of kings and Lord of lords.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who only hath immortality, and dwelleth in the light that none can attain unto, whom never man saw, neither can see, unto whom be honor and power everlasting, Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Charge them that are rich in this world, that they be not high minded, and that they trust not in uncertain riches, but in the living God, (which giveth us abundantly all things to enjoy.)
speaker: Narrator

text: That they do good, and be rich in good works, and be ready to distribute, and communicate,
speaker: Narrator

text: Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may obtain eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Timothy, keep that which is committed unto thee, and avoid profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Which while some profess, they have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee, Amen.
¶The first Epistle to Timothy, written from Laodicea, which is the chiefest city of Phrygia Pacatiana.
speaker: Narrator
